text:
The actress responds to tweets implying she was scowling at Blake Lively and Emily Blunt.

Award shows and other high-profile events are fertile grounds for taking and then misinterpreting screenshots and video clips of people's facial expressions. Winona Ryder, for example, couldn't hear parts of an acceptance speech while on stage with the cast of Stranger Things at the SAG Awards, leading her to make faces that people interpreted as, well, strange — but people didn't know the reasonable explanation until later. And Dakota Johnson was recently said to be side-eyeing Angelina Jolie during Jennifer Aniston's Golden Globes speech, but the Fifty Shades actress explained that she really was trying to get a good look at her favorite actors from Stranger Things, who were seated at another table.

Such is the case with Zendaya, who some thought was scowling at Blake Lively and Emily Blunt while they were all sitting together at the Michael Kors runway show at New York Fashion Week.

Except she wasn't. She was just trying to get a good look at the fashion!

"I was looking at the runway," she tweet-shouted.

Now that's cleared up.
title: NYFW: Zendaya Didn't Scowl at Blake Lively and Emily Blunt
